results.title: Ready to type
results.brief_description: Designed for showing to students beginning typing classes. Shows the importance of developing a procedure for getting ready to type. A comparison is made between two students, one of whom follows a pattern of procedure and the other who commences work without any preparation.

results.title: Ready for action
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Australian news and Information Bureau and Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia)
results.brief_description: Film trailer on bushfire prevention. Summer always brings the curse of fire. Photographed at a fire-control field day held at Wyong, N.S.W., this short film illustrates how firemen prepare for the threat of fire. They overhaul their organisation, communications equipment and gear; safeguard buildings before the fire season commences; practise in using fire-fighting equipment; construct fire-breaks and practice mopping up after a fire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Australian news and Information Bureau and Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia)

results.title: Reading photographs
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
The works of specific photographers are examined to illustrate that visual communication carries more emotional, political and cultural impact than verbal communication. Warns the viewer to be aware of various visual stimuli.

results.title: Reading on
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Follow up to “Beginning Reading” which looked at reading in the infant school. This program looks at strategies for the teaching of reading from Years 3-7. Practising clasroom teachers present their individual approaches for the teaching of reading at these levels.

results.title: Reading maps
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Designed for use in elementary social studies teaching, this film is an introduction to the study of maps, A young boy leans about the use of maps by following roads and by locating various places. He is shown how to read a map by observing the title, scale, direction symbols and legend.

results.title: Reading is....
results.creator_credit: Don MacDonald, Mark Chodzko and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship that develops between a young boy and an older girl through a common bond - reading. The girl is having difficulties in her family life because of her brother’s terminal illness: she finds a release from this stress when, with the encouragement of the young boy who is a keen reader, she develops an awareness of the benefits of reading. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Reading activities with young children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Examines a variety of reading activities going on in one classroom in an infant school in Cheshire. Shows a sample of activities in pet corner. We also see part of storytime for the youngest children and children reading to the teacher.

results.title: Read the label and live!
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of reading the warnings found on labels of commonly used products. Illustrates safe handling practices for medicines, paint thinners, hair spray, insecticides and other commonly used preparations. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
